_meta.description: Raw crafting materials (ores, logs, crystals) - gathered resources

values: A soft, reddish metal found in shallow veins near the surface. Easy to work with basic tools but lacks the durability needed for serious combat. The foundation of all smithing - every blacksmith's first lesson.
Ash-grey substance from legendary phoenix nests. Burns eternally without being consumed.
Blue crystal filled with flowing liquid. Cool and calming, perpetually damp.
Brilliant white stone that glows faintly with captured sunlight. Used in temples and monuments.
Captured lightning from primordial storms. Contains raw creation energy.
Common sedimentary rock with fine grain. Compressed clay particles form water-resistant layers.
Common sedimentary rock. Soft enough to carve with basic tools yet strong enough for simple construction.
Concentrated essence that remembers being alive. Key ingredient in high-grade potions.
Crackling crystal surrounded by static discharge. Handle with insulated gloves.
Creamy-white wood from elegant trees. Highly valued for its fine grain and excellent carving properties.
Crystallized blood from elemental beasts. Pulses with residual power.
Crystallized darkness that absorbs light. Uncomfortable to look at directly.
Dark, impossibly hard metal that absorbs light. Found only in the deepest caverns where the world's bones are exposed.
Deep black wood from ancient forests. Absorbs and nullifies magical energies.
Dense hardwood with beautiful figuring. Resists warping and holds its shape through temperature extremes.
Dense metamorphic rock with distinctive banding. Exceptional compression strength.
Ethereal substance from creatures between worlds. Exists partially out of phase.
Frost-blue crystal cold enough to burn. Creates rime patterns on nearby surfaces.
Gleaming golden metal with an otherworldly green-blue sheen. Ancient civilizations built empires on its discovery.
Green-brown crystal with swirling sediment. Surprisingly heavy, grounds magical energies.
Harder and more durable than pure iron. The secret of its strength lies in its carbon-rich structure. A true warrior's metal.
Impossibly perfect geometric form that cannot exist in three-dimensional space, yet here it is.
Iridescent shell segment. Lightweight yet remarkably impact-resistant.
Legendary silver-white metal that seems to drink in moonlight and starshine. Impossibly light yet incredibly strong.
Light, flexible wood harvested from tall conifers. Works easily under a blade, bends without breaking.
Liquid darkness given physical form. Absorbs heat, light, and hope.
Living wood from the World Tree's roots. Contains millennia of accumulated magical essence.
Metal that simultaneously exists in multiple states. Scholars argue whether it's matter or energy, present or future. It is all of these and none.
Metallic scales from armored creatures. Can deflect sword strikes.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Nearly indestructible metal that can withstand forces that would shatter lesser materials. Each ingot represents months of careful refinement.
Orange-red crystal pulsing with trapped flames. Warm to touch, occasionally sparks.
Pale crystal that drifts upward if not secured. Contains compressed winds.
Pale wood with excellent shock absorption. Weapon handles made from ash feel alive in your grip.
Perfect crystalline structure that refracts reality itself. Entire fortunes built on single specimens.
Petrified remains from ancient guardians. Contains geological memories.
Pitch-black stone that seems to pull light into itself. Radiates subtle wrongness.
Radiant crystal glowing with inner light. Pushes back shadows naturally.
Rare wood with metallic properties. As hard as soft metals, holds edges almost as well as iron.
Razor-sharp fang from alpha predators. Still warm from the kill.
Reality-bending metal that has transcended conventional physics. Durability frozen in time, effects can occur before cause.
Refined ash planks with superior shock absorption properties.
Refined birch planks, perfect for detailed craftwork.
Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Refined ebony planks, perfect for anti-magic applications.
Refined ironwood planks, nearly as strong as actual metal.
Refined maple planks, ideal for items requiring stability.
Refined mithril that whispers of ancient secrets. Perfect for weapons that need both power and grace.
Refined oak planks with improved durability and quality.
Refined pine planks, perfect for bows and flexible constructions.
Refined tin with excellent magical conductivity. Used in alloys and enchanted items.
Refined worldtree planks that remember their connection to the source.
Reliable, sturdy timber from ancient oaks. Dense grain, strong fibers, and a warm golden-brown hue. The standard by which all other woods are measured.
Rough grey pelt from common wolves. Durable but coarse, requires treatment to soften.
Soft, silvery-white metal with a mysterious sheen that glows faintly in moonlight. Ancient texts speak of its lunar affinity.
Solidified probability space. Can be shaped into predetermined or random outcomes.
Speckled igneous rock with visible crystalline structure. Harder than limestone, more reliable for load-bearing structures.
Stone that remembers everything it witnesses. Contains geological memory of eons.
Sturdy grey metal from common deposits throughout the land. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, and strong enough for most purposes.
Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.
Suspended in perpetual crystallization. Neither fully solid nor energy, exists in quantum superposition.
The pinnacle of mortal metallurgy. Channels both physical force and magical energy with perfect efficiency.
Translucent crystal that amplifies magical energies passing through it. Hums softly when near power sources.
Translucent gelatinous substance. Surprisingly elastic and adhesive when processed.
Volcanic glass born in the heart of eruptions. Extremely sharp edges, incredibly brittle structure.

metadata.narrative: Pitch-black stone that seems to pull light into itself. Radiates subtle wrongness.

A soft, reddish metal found in shallow veins near the surface. Easy to work with basic tools but lacks the durability needed for serious combat. The foundation of all smithing - every blacksmith's first lesson.
Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Sturdy grey metal from common deposits throughout the land. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, and strong enough for most purposes.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Soft, silvery-white metal with a mysterious sheen that glows faintly in moonlight. Ancient texts speak of its lunar affinity.
